page.title: 15Changing Times
page.content: We talked to Mr and Mrs Jones of Leysters who have lived in the village all their lives. Mr Jones was born in 1894,married at 18 and had 7 children.He worked as a waggoner on a local farm doing ploughing;reaping and planting.The 3 men made 100 gallon hogsheads of cider and drank them for breakfast,dinner and tea,and between times carried a wooden gallon barrel called a 'coastral'.He started work at 6.30am getting horses ready and finished at 6.00pm for a wage of 25 shillings a week.At harvest he worked all hours and had no holidays.Food was carried in a "frail"and eaten when the men stopped for "bate".At night he would do the garden and feed the pig.They had no radio but he remembers the first crystal set.
